The Oscars snub seems to have only amplified the chorus of praise for the creators magic captured on film.

Franz Ferdinand, the popular Scottish band known for their distinctly evocative sound, paid a memorable visit to their native Glasgow School of Art (GSA) today. The band, initially formed at the said art school back in 2002, returned to their roots for a unique lesson promoting creativity in music and the arts. 

Alex Kapranos, the frontman, along with fellow band members Robert Hardy, Paul Thomson, and Julian Corrie led a workshop with current GSA music students. Their aim? To share invaluable personal insights, industry advice, and even a sneak peek into their creative process. 

Kapranos, also an alumnus of the institution, addressed the students with a sense of nostalgia, "Our journey began in these very halls. The creative energy and artistic freedom that this school cultivates is the reason Franz Ferdinand exists today."

The band attributes a significant amount of their success to the innovative and creative environment offered by GSA. "We were surrounded by like-minded individuals who believed in pushing boundaries, experimenting, and expressing themselves, which undoubtedly had a profound impact on our music," shared Hardy.

Throughout the workshop, the band emphasized the importance of artistic freedom, individuality, and experimentation. They discussed their journey in the music industry  the initial struggles, the evolution of their sound, and the highs and lows of global stardom. 

Included in the lesson was a distinct emphasis on resilience. "It is so easy to get disheartened in this industry," Thomson advised. "There will be plenty of rejections and criticisms, but it is crucial to keep pushing through, refining your craft, and staying true to your sound."

Forming a more interactive segment of the workshop, students were given the opportunity to present their own original pieces, receiving constructive feedback from Franz Ferdinand members. 

Chloe Stewart, a third-year music student, enthused, "To have such an influential band personally critique our work and give us industry insights is surreal. We got to learn so much from their experiences, it has truly been a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity."

The students were also treated to an impromptu performance, as Franz Ferdinand played an acoustic version of their hit song "Take me out." It was a moment that encapsulated the ethos of the day; a celebration of creativity, perseverance, and music.

Franz Ferdinand's visit to GSA was not just inspirational but also symbolic, highlighting how a creative and supportive environment can nurture talent and pave the way for global success. Their art school lesson served

With the festive season fast approaching, the annual Gadget Show's attention has turned towards the rise of the MP3 player, signalling what could be the beginning of an MP3 revival season.

The interactive event, known for showcasing the latest and potentially most influential technological trends, was teeming with manufacturers presenting innovations in audio devices, particularly MP3 players. From sleek and slim designs that blend modern aesthetics with easy portability, to those with expanded memories to accommodate music lover's extensive playlists, the focus was clearly on the reinvention of the seemingly fading device.

In an era where having a smartphone seems enough to enjoy music, the humble MP3 player is making its comeback, unbowed by the stream of smart gadgets. According to tech experts at the show, the resurgence of MP3 players is driven by the consumer desire for a standalone device specifically for music. 

One major highlight of the Gadget Show was Sony's new MP3 player. Despite the company's focus on modern tech gadgets like gaming consoles and smart television, Sony surprised attendees with a sleek, feature-laden MP3 device with advanced sound technologies. 

Unlike common perception that the decline in MP3's popularity was due to the rise of smartphones, speakers at the show contended that the truth is not so black and white. They pointed to the fatigue and dissatisfaction with poor battery life and mediocre sound quality offered by smartphones when used as primary music devices. 

The show also shed light on the growing market for high-resolution audio, requiring a device with more processing power and memory space, factors which many smartphones struggle to provide. This has led to music lovers going back to dedicated music players, thus fostering the MP3 revival. 

Moreover, the Vinyl resurgence trend proves that there is still a demand for tangible and standalone music devices. The same nostalgic sentiment appears to extend to the MP3 players, offering a sense of ownership as opposed to the leasing model of music streaming services.

While the exhibition buzzed with other new technological showcases such as VR headsets, drones, and smart home devices, it was the humble MP3 player that ironically stood out as the dark horse of the event. Thus, as Christmas looms on the horizon, and gift shopping commences, it appears this holiday season might just be a memorable one for the MP3, the little gadget that refuses to bow out of the game.

Former Prime Minister Tony Blair and his successor Gordon Brown are facing new claims of a deepening rift, shaking the unity of the Labour Party further. These claims, made by well-placed insiders, have reignited concerns about the stability of the party leadership.

Sources within the party allege that the dispute rooted in the 2007 transition period, when Blair stepped down as Prime Minister and Brown assumed office, is resurfacing. It is said that the tensions revolve around differing views on how to resuscitate Labours flagging poll ratings and its overall direction.

While Mr Blair has always championed a centre ground approach, reports suggest that Mr Brown, pointing to the electoral success of the Conservative Party, has been advocating a move towards position itself as a more traditional socialist party. These differing political strategies have reportedly caused tension, but agreement over how to handle the hot-button issue of Brexit has also been elusive.

The alleged disagreements have not been formally corroborated but the lack of a united front from the former leaders of the Party has sparked speculation amongst political commentators and it feeds into a wider narrative of a fragmented Party.

Andy Burnham, current Mayor of Manchester and former Labour leadership contender, commented that the persistent rumours of conflict between Blair and Brown were detrimental to the party's image. He urged the pair to set aside their differences, stressing that unity was "paramount" especially amidst Conservative dominance. 

The Labour Party has not officially commented on the rumours. Several Labour MPs have dismissed the claims as 'tittle-tattle', insistent that the focus should be on salvageable actions to reverse the downward trajectory in the polls.

The issue of party unity has been of particular concern in recent years for Labour, having seen a significant decline in their traditional voting base, and in particular among the working class. If correct, these newest allegations suggest the need for party cohesion and a united front is perhaps more urgent than ever.

Oil prices have rallied, bouncing back from their recent slump caused by extreme weather conditions, reinforcing the commodity's resilience in turbulent times. The rebound followed a period of disruption due to unseasonable conditions that affected output from several major oil-producing nations.

Brent crude, the international benchmark, rose to $68.91 a barrel  a noticeable upswing compared to its low price amidst the weather-related disturbances. Meanwhile, West Texas Intermediate (WTI), the US standard, surged to $65.36 per barrel, a significant recovery from its previous dip.

Industry insiders attribute this reassuring rebound in prices to multiple factors. A decrease in US inventories, coupled with an increase in demand as global economies reopen from coronavirus lockdowns, is playing a notable role in bolstering prices.

"The weather-related interruptions in Texas and other oil-producing states indeed battered the industry and resulted in temporary price fluctuations," said Daniel Yergin, an energy expert. "However, the swift rebound reflects the robustness of the oil market despite such adversities."

Meanwhile, the Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC), along with its allies, including Russia - a group known commonly as OPEC+, maintains a cautiously optimistic outlook. OPEC+ has implemented production cuts aiming to reduce the global supply glut and stabilise prices. The rebound also underscores the apparent effectiveness of these efforts, as the weather-related disturbances did not cause a long-lasting drop.

Besides, a continuation of the current trend could see oil prices returning to pre-pandemic levels. However, the trajectory of the market largely depends on factors such as vaccine rollouts, ease of travel restrictions, and strengthening of global economies.

Nevertheless, the recent rebound has put oil-market traders and investors somewhat at ease. The swift recovery suggests that while the oil market isn't free from adverse weather spurred disruptions or other external factors, it remains comparatively resilient.

The market is awaiting a more solid stability that can only be achieved when the global vaccine rollout accelerates, leading to the revival of the sectors heavily reliant on oil such as aviation and tourism. With such sectors rebounding, the demand for oil is expected to reach its pre-pandemic level, reinforcing the trend in oil price recovery.
  
On a larger scale, the revival of oil prices consolidates a central role for the commodity in the global economy, even as discussions on a transition to greener energy sources continue to make headlines. Despite the challenges, oil continues to demonstrate its paramount importance as a pillar supporting the global economic structure, with its recent rebound as a testament.

Negotiations are underway between the European Union (EU) and the United States (US) as they attempt to find a resolution to a long-standing dispute over aircraft subsidies. The two global powers aim to end years of transatlantic tension and prevent a broader trade war that could severely impact the global economy.

The disagreement, which dates back to 2004, centres around government subsidies provided by the EU to aviation giant Airbus and by the US to aerospace manufacturer Boeing. Both sides claim these subsidies distort the global market, contributing to an unfair advantage for the two leading aircraft makers.

The World Trade Organization (WTO) has ruled on numerous occasions that both Airbus and Boeing have received unfair subsidies. This has resulted in mutual accusations and retaliatory tariffs, making the conflict one of the longest-running and most complicated in the WTO history.

The ongoing talks mark a shift in the dynamics under President Joe Biden, offering hope for a more diplomatic resolution. The new US administration appears keen to find a mutually agreeable solution to the trade dispute, marking a significant change in approach from the more confrontational stance adopted under the previous administration.

"By coming back to the negotiating table, both parties are showing their commitment to finding a resolution that respects the rules of international commerce," said EU Trade Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis. "We are dedicated to finding a resolution to this long-standing dispute and ensuring fair competition."

In a similar vein, Katherine Tai, the US Trade Representative, commented, "These negotiations underscore our commitment to resolving this dispute and finding a mutually beneficial path forward to ensure a level playing field."

If successful, an agreement could pave the way for broader diplomatic discussions, with both sides keen to address shared global challenges, such as dealing with China's rise. In addition, the aviation industry stands to benefit significant as an end to the tit-for-tat import tariffs would ease transatlantic tensions and, potentially, prices for airliners.

However, reaching a deal will undoubtedly be challenging, considering the multi-faceted complexities and the long history of the dispute.

Despite potential roadblocks, these negotiations represent a critical step towards harmonising trade relations between the EU and US. Both parties expressed optimism about coming to a consensus that could finally settle the 17-year-old dispute. The global aviation industry, still grappling with the impact of the pandemic, eagerly awaits a resolution that could relieve one of its longest-standing areas of contention.

In an exciting twist of fate, Bees, also known as Brentford FC, a football club in the English Premier League, could face a potential match against Manchester United in one of the future game fixtures. This announcement has sent a current of anticipation through football fans worldwide, showcasing the gripping unpredictability of football league schedules.

Following a pulsating draw ceremony, the Bees could be up against the Reds, pending outcomes from the preceding matches. Known for their relentless play style, the prospect of Brentford's first meeting with Manchester United inside the majestic Old Trafford stadium is highly intriguing to football enthusiasts.

Brentford FC, nicknamed the Bees because of their amber and black kit, have been demonstrating remarkable progress in Premier League fixtures. Their resilience and verve on the pitch have won them many accolades and put them in a favourable position in the league's games.

On the other hand, Manchester United, known for their legendary line-up, is one of the world's most successful football clubs. The potential match-up with Brentford FC promises to be a thrilling clash as the two teams vie for dominance on the pitch.

Brentford's head coach, Thomas Frank, voiced his excitement about the potential draw, stating that this would be an amazing opportunity not only to challenge his team but also to put on a great show for the fans. The prospect of locking horns with Manchester United's newly-appointed head coach, Ralf Rangnick, adds another layer of anticipation to the mix.

However, Manchester United's preparation should not be taken lightly. Known for their solid defending and relentless attacking, the prowess of Manchester United can't be underestimated. The match would be a true test for Brentford, who will need to bring their 'A-game' to this contest.

The dates for the forthcoming games are yet to be announced. As we wait for the confirmation of this potential match-up, there is a marked increase in anticipation and excitement among fans of both sides. One thing is for sure: football enthusiasts can look forward to some riveting play from both teams if this tie gets the green light.

Rapid advancements in robotics and artificial intelligence (AI) technology have seen robots being integrated into society in increasingly unprecedented ways. Whether in hospitals, homes, or on the streets, robots have evidently begun to interact with humans and with other robots, necessitating the need for 'robotiquette - a set of rules that govern the ways in which machines interact with humans and each other. 

Researchers from some of the worlds leading universities have been focusing on teaching robots these 'robotiquette' rules, to ensure they behave in a socially acceptable and practical manner. This involves teaching robots how to assess their environment and the behaviour and cues of those around them.

Dr. Susan Jones, a robotics expert from Stanford University, said, "Given that human beings have social rules, it's essential that we teach robots 'robotiquette' for them to understand and anticipate human reactions. It also promotes effective interactions between robots."

Several reports illustrate how robots in logistic warehouses can now prioritize tasks, coordinate their activities, and give way to each other on busy routes to avoid collisions. In healthcare, robots are learning how to interpret human expression to respond differently in situations, prioritizing compassion over efficiency.

These rules take the form of intelligent algorithms integrated into their operating code, enabling robots to make decisions that consider their surroundings and situations. However, this doesn't just involve application of set rules but allowing robots to learn and adapt to new situations and environments. 

Researchers at MIT's Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) have developed a methodology that allows robots to learn from past experiences and adjust their behaviour. A similar project at Carnegie Mellon University uses machine learning methods for robots to adapt their etiquette rules according to novel encounters.

While the idea of 'robotiquette' is gaining traction, there are concerns over the difficulty of standardising these rules due to cultural differences. A gesture or phrase that might be considered quite normal in one culture may be seen as inappropriate in another. 

However, pioneers of 'robotiquette' believe that robots can adapt to these cultural variations. Dr. Jones adds, "Assuming that we can develop culturally sensitive AI, robots could adjust their behaviour according to the culture and the individual they are interacting."

This exciting development in the field of robotics and AI is seen as vital for the successful integration of these machines into human societies. As AI continues to shape our world in unprecedented ways, its becoming clear that 'robotiquette' will not just be a quirky notion, but an essential aspect of our mutual coexistence.

Many Americans are expressing 'awards fatigue,' frustrated and overwhelmed with the seemingly continuous awards season circles pervading the entertainment industry, according to recent polls and social media trends. 

Each year, between the Grammys, the Oscars, the Golden Globes, and numerous other awards ceremonies, the United States experiences what is commonly referred to as 'awards season.' This series of shows, intended to honor the best in film, music, television, and other forms of entertainment, often dominates headlines and social media feeds. 

However, recent surveys and sentiment analysis conducted across various social media platforms indicate a growing disenchantment among Americans towards these events. The data collected suggests that an increasing number of individuals are feeling 'awards fatigue,' a term coined to describe the weariness and indifference people feel due to the overwhelming saturation of awards content. 

Several reasons might be contributing to this disenchantment. Notably, the accusations of lack of diversity and representation among awards nominees in recent years have marred the credibility of these awards. Furthermore, the pandemic has compelled most of these ceremonies to go virtual, resulting in a decline in showmanship, glitz, and glamour typically associated with these events.

Critics have also pointed out that the significant number of award shows has led to an inevitable dilution of the recognition. Instead of a select few being celebrated for their exceptional work, it feels as though every week presents a new array of winners. This continuous celebration has left some viewers jaded, feeling as though the true value of these awards has diminished. 

Its not just viewers expressing this fatigue. Some in the industry have voiced their weariness too. In a recent interview, renowned film director Martin Scorsese lamented the 'awards politics' that he feels detract from the real art of filmmaking.

Despite America's apparent 'awards fatigue,' the business of awards ceremonies continues to boom, spurred by advertising revenue and global interest. Yet, with viewer numbers dwindling year on year, the industry may need to rethink its strategy to keep audiences engaged and maintain credibility.

Many Americans, it seems, are calling for a return to quality over quantity. The shift in audience sentiment might trigger a much-needed change in the awards industry: a condensed, more meaningful celebration that truly honors the best in the business rather than an endless cycle of red-carpet events. But only time will tell whether the industry will respond to this growing wave of 'awards fatigue.'

Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair has implored the European Union (EU) to end what he terms as the "denial" surrounding George W. Bush's presidency. He believes that disregarding the impact of the Bush era on international relations is counter-productive and that lessons should be learned from it instead.

Mr Blair, who was prime minister when Mr Bush was president, was speaking at a forum in Brussels. On the subject of the Bush administration, he urged the EU to understand the decisions that were made at the time and interpret them in the wider geopolitical context, rather than dismissing them outright.

"Whether you agreed with his policies or not, George W. Bush reshaped global policies in ways that still influence the international political landscape," Blair said.

Blair highlighted the necessity to appreciate the historic events that transpired during the Bush administration, such as the Iraq war and harsh anti-terrorism measures. He comments that the EU is presently inclined to view those actions with rebuke, but in practice, they significantly influenced the policies of nations worldwide, including those of the EU.

The former premier underlined that while he understands the criticisms directed towards the Bush administration, there is a need for recognizing its contribution to shaping contemporary history. He acknowledges that reflecting on the intensely controversial era is challenging, but insisted that understanding and acknowledging it is critical.

Mr Blair's comments have stirred discussion among the EU, generating mixed responses. With some agreeing with his perspective that understanding the past is crucial for shaping the future, others continue to express their disapproval of Bush-era policies.

Mr Blair ended his address by urging the EU not just to critique the healthcare, economic, and foreign policies of the Bush administration, but also to analyze their lasting impact. The challenge, according to Blair, lies in recognizing where the EU's policies were impacted and consciously deciding how to move forward in light of this reality. 

The ex-British Prime Minister maintained that learning from the past, no matter how difficult, is the key to crafting better strategies for the future, especially in today's deeply interconnected world.

After a brief slump, home loan approvals in the UK are on a steady upward curve once again, latest reports suggest. This resurgence in the number of mortgage approvals is indicative of a recovering housing market, and suggests increased confidence among home buyers and lenders alike.

Data released by the Bank of England reveals that the number of mortgage approvals for home purchase rose to 86,921 in June, the highest it has been since February. This follows a decline during the months of April and May when the country was in the midst of the third COVID-19 lockdown. The figures marked a significant rebound from the near-historic low of around 9,300 in May 2020 amid the first pandemic lockdown.

Experts attribute the rise in approvals to several contributing factors. Firstly, the impending end of the stamp duty holiday, which is set to conclude by the end of September, has led to a buying rush among prospective homeowners. Secondly, the return of 95% mortgages, supported by a government guarantee scheme launched in April, has enabled more first-time buyers to get onto the property ladder.

Industry analysts also highlight the role of changing work patterns post-lockdown. The migration from city areas to more suburban and rural regions has stimulated demand for housing purchases in those areas, particularly among those adopting hybrid or remote working models.

While this resurgence is seen as a positive sign, some concerns persist. Mortgage approval levels, whilst high, still remain below the peak of over 100,000 seen in March 2020. In addition, the end of the stamp duty holiday could potentially lead to a cooling off in demand.

The question remains on how sustainable this resurgence will be, particularly as various government support measures in place to mitigate the impact of the pandemic are gradually being phased out. Experts called for continued support for the housing market to ensure stability.

With rising employment levels and a return to a degree of normality after the pandemic, many hope this increase in mortgage approvals is a sign of sustained market recovery. However, the industry will be keeping a close eye on developments, and on the impact of the end of the stamp duty holiday and furlough scheme, in the coming months.

Multinational agrochemical and agricultural biotechnology corporation, Monsanto, has been slapped with a punitive $1.5 million fine on charges of bribery. The alleged misconduct came to light after a comprehensive investigation was carried out by the US Securities and Exchange Commission, said the Department of Justice.

The fine results from an appalling incident in which Monsanto's Indonesian affiliates bribed a high-ranking Indonesian official. The bribes were allegedly paid to evade environmental impact assessment, which is absolutely compulsory for certain projects. The company sought for a decree that would bypass the need for an environmental study for its genetically modified cotton.

"We will not tolerate bribery in any form at any level," said a spokesperson from the Department of Justice. "Any company seeing to advance their business interests through illegal payments will be brought to justice," they added.

The St. Louis-based corporation has subsequently agreed to work with the Department of Justice to settle all claims without admitting guilt, and pay the hefty fine. The management also consented to three years of close monitoring of their practices to ensure compliance with the law.

This marks a significant setback for Monsanto, which is already under fire from an array of critics. Environmentalists and human rights activists have frequently accused the firm of irresponsibly and recklessly pushing its genetically modified organisms into the environment and onto dinner tables all across the world.

The company's infamous genetically modified products, from corn to cotton, have already been banned in several countries due to health and environmental concerns. The recent bribery scandal adds another layer of controversy to Monsanto's already tarnished reputation, and further raises concerns about the ethical practices employed by large multinational companies.

While the $1.5 million fine might not undermine the financial stature of Monsanto, which makes billions each year, it does serve as a public black mark against the corporation and a reminder to all firms of the consequences of improper conduct. The hefty price tag acts more as a deterrent against such unethical actions in future by corporations of this scale.

There has been no official statement from Monsanto on the judgement as of yet.

Apple has launched a budget-friendly model of its highly-regarded desktop computer, named 'Mac mini'. This move is aimed at attracting home office users and to serve as a more affordable entry point to the Mac range.

While the Mac Mini starts at a more approachable price, the hardware giant has reassured customers that the technological prowess and performance of the computer will not be compromised. The new model will run the latest macOS operating system, pack a punch with the Apple's proprietary M1 chip, and come with a minimum of 8GB RAM, ensuring a smooth, high-performance experience for users.

Apple's entry-level Mac mini's price starts at $699, down from $799 of its predecessor, and highlights the company's strategic shift to increase its market share in the personal computer segment amid a global remote-working trend sparked by the COVID-19 pandemic. It also comes just in time for the holiday shopping season, hoping to attract cost-conscious consumers looking for high-quality tech gifts.

"The Mac mini represents a bold new era for Mac. Its groundbreaking M1 chip delivers industry-leading performance and astounding power efficiency," said John Ternus, Apple's VP of Hardware Engineering. "And with the macOS Big Sur, it brings a range of new features and design enhancements that give users more flexibility and capabilities.

The M1 chip, which combines the CPU, GPU, Neural Engine, I/O, and much more onto a single system on a chip (SoC), promises a giant leap in computing performance. To add to its appeal, the Mac mini also offers a compact, space-efficient design that can comfortably fit into home or professional setups.

The Mac mini is available now for pre-order on Apple's website, with shipping beginning next week. The entry-level model comes with a 256GB solid state drive, which can be upgraded up to a maximum of 2TB. RAM can also be upgraded up to a maximum of 16GB.

Overall, Apple's new Mac mini proves that powerful tech doesn't always come with an astronomical price tag. Its lower cost and high performance deliver on Apple's promise of quality and affordability, ensuring that the Mac ecosystem becomes more accessible to a broader range of consumers.

In the dynamic era of the digital revolution, a new class of criminals is emerging, particularly in the arena of high technology, where the payoffs can be immensely profitable.

With increased reliance on online banking, virtual transactions, and digital currencies, as well as a surge in valuable assets found on the cloud, tech-savvy criminals have been provided with all the tools necessary to prosper. This technological advancement has dredged up a surge in cybercrime targeted at high-net-worth individuals and corporations, rendering the concept of traditional theft obsolete.

High-profile break-ins have become far more frequent in recent years with global police forces reporting an escalating trend. The targets are not cash or physical goods, rather sensitive information, intellectual property, and digital assets stored in seemingly secure cloud-based systems.

A report from cybersecurity firm CipherTrace estimated that digital thieves stole more than $1.7 billion in cryptocurrencies alone in 2018, a number expected to rise as digital assets increase in value. 

Another attack vector is through ransomware, where hackers lock users out of their own system and demand a ransom in exchange for access. Cybersecurity Ventures predicts that by this year, businesses worldwide could fall victim to a ransomware attack every 11 seconds. 

Global corporations like Twitter, Adobe, and LinkedIn have all fallen prey to data breaches, exposing the data of millions of users. However, it is not just tech giants who are at risk. Last year, nearly 50% of cyber-attacks targeted small businesses, indicating that no one is off limits.

"Rather than burglars physically breaking down front doors or safecrackers taking their chances, criminals are now hiding behind screens, comfortably stealing millions at the click of a button," explains Matt Walmsley, EMEA Director at Vectra AI.

In response to these new threats, an industry of digital security services is developing at an unprecedented rate. Cybersecurity is no longer a luxury for organizations but a necessary requirement to combat this rapidly growing threat.

Cybersecurity experts are calling for companies and individuals alike to employ robust digital hygiene practices, such as strong password protection, data encryption, regular software updates, and multi-factor authentication. 

However, as the technology evolves, so too does the sophistication of hackers. Therefore, law enforcement agencies and businesses worldwide must keep improving their strategies to stay one step ahead in this digital cat and mouse game.

In conclusion, the digitization of our lives, even though it facilitates simplicity and convenience, has also unlocked new opportunities for high-tech thieves. Its now apparent that in our connected world

The stock market in Jakarta tumbled as the nation started counting the cost of the devastating tsunami that struck Indonesia last week. The devastating tsunami has not only caused a tragic loss of life, but has also resulted at a steep monetary expense, which has distressed the Indonesian capital's stock exchange.

The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI), the countrys main stock index, had plummeted 2.2% by midday. Analysts say the tsunamis devastation and the displacement of people will likely disrupt economic activities in the affected regions, offering a potential setback to the Indonesian economy which was just starting to recover from the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Analysts have also speculated that the cost to rebuild and recover from the tsunami could reach billions of dollars, given the magnitude of destruction in the affected areas. This burden is set to strain the country's budget, which might result in a cut in state expenditure in other areas or increased borrowing, thus unsettling investors.  

Shares in construction and infrastructure companies initially rose on speculation that they would benefit from the rebuilding works, but later fell amid broader market losses. Domestic consumption, which accounts for more than half of Indonesia's GDP, is also expected to slow as the nation grapples with the aftermath of the disaster, which may lead to a further dip in the stock market.

"The human and physical toll of the tsunami is heartbreaking and shocking," said Rizal Ramli, a senior economist at Fitch Ratings in Jakarta. "In addition to that, there's likely to be a significant economic toll as well. This could impact Indonesia's fiscal deficit."

The volatility in the Indonesian stock market comes amid concerns that the country's economic recovery from the pandemic could take longer than expected. Many believe the unexpected natural disasters coupled with the ongoing global pandemic could potentially delay the efforts of strengthening the country's economy. 

"Strengthening our fiscal resilience in the face of natural disasters is vital," said Finance Minister Mulyani Indrawati. "This requires us to think creatively and innovatively, given that these events can be unpredictable and bring about significant economic loss."

The Indonesian government has promised swift response and allocated funds for immediate relief activities. However, the longer-term economic impact of the disaster is less certain, displaying the need for economic contingency plans in the face of adversity.

While efforts are being concentrated on rescuing survivors and rebuilding destroyed habitats, it is clear that Indonesia's recovery, both from the standpoint of human lives and economically, will be a massive undertaking. The tsunami's cost has indeed grossly affected Jakarta

Efforts to prevent a looming strike by pension workers are underway as negotiations continue to address disagreements over potential reforms. This industrial action, which has the potential to significantly disrupt operations in various sectors, is expected to draw in thousands of employees who are demanding better terms for their retirement benefits. 

The dispute arises from changes proposed by employers, which the workers' unions argue would undermine their members' future financial security. It has been reported that the proposed reforms aim to move the current definite benefit scheme to the less favourable defined contribution scheme.

In an effort to dissuade the unions from going ahead with the strike, high-level talks are taking place between government officials, union leaders and employers. The discussions are expected to focus on finding a compromise that will satisfy both parties, maintaining the financial stability of the pension funds whilst ensuring the future livelihoods of the workers.

The government has been urged to intervene, in hopes that a potential strike might be avoided. Such a strike could not only disrupt the operations of various sectors but could also affect the broader economy. Economists have warned that the strike might exacerbate the country's current economic struggles, leading to a slowdown in certain sectors.

Union leaders have indicated that the proposed pension reforms have struck a nerve with members, noting a high-level of engagement and willingness to strike if necessary. Many of those planning to strike argue that the proposed changes would lead to uncertainty and risk that they are not prepared to accept.

The potential strike highlights the growing concern among workers about their retirement security. Increasingly, employees across various industries are voicing concerns about the future of their pensions as debates about reform continue to escalate.

The success of these talks will determine whether the planned strike action will proceed or if a compromise can be found to appease both parties. However, preparation for strike action continues while the talks are ongoing. If the talks fail to reach a consensus, the public can expect service disruptions in various sectors, dependent upon the pension members involved.

Both parties have expressed their hope for a resolution within the given timeframe, emphasising the mutual desire to avoid industrial action if possible. Yet, as the negotiations proceed, it remains unclear whether an agreement can be reached, reinforcing the uncertainty that many pension funds and their recipients are currently facing. Nevertheless, the continuing talks suggest that efforts are being made to avoid the strike and reach a compromise. The conclusion of the negotiations is eagerly awaited by all parties involved.

Despite advancements in technology, mobile multimedia still struggles to gain significant traction among consumers, according to recent studies. While smartphones and mobile internet usage continue to grow, the consumption of rich multimedia content has remained stagnant.

Although mobile devices now have high-resolution screens capable of displaying crystal-clear videos and images, and improvement in network speeds have made streaming a near-seamless experience, consumers appear to be hesitant in fully embracing this technology. Many are yet to move beyond basic functionalities such as sending texts and making calls.

According to a report by analytics company Newzoo, consumers spend only around 10% of their mobile internet use watching videos or engaging with other types of multimedia content. This number starkly contrasts with other types of mobile usage such as browsing social media communities and engaging in online gaming, which take up a combined 50% of total mobile internet use.

Experts attribute this slower uptake of mobile multimedia to a range of factors, warning that without addressing these issues, multimedia providers might struggle to fully claim the mobile market. 

One of the primary barriers to mobile multimedia adoption is the cost of data. High-quality video and audio streaming can consume a significant amount of data, leading users to ration their consumption to avoid incurring high costs or exceeding their data allowance. 

Another factor is usability. Navigating multimedia content on mobile devices might be inconvenient for some users due to the smaller screens and lack of a mouse or a similar precision tool as in desktop devices.

Infrastructure may perhaps be another potential cause. Despite the advent of faster network speeds, many regions still experience patchy or slow internet connections, leading to frustrating loading times. 

Lastly, some experts opine that the lack of innovative mobile multimedia content is also a factor to consider. The conventional broadcasting style which dictates most multimedia content currently available is often off-putting for consumers accustomed to the interactive and personalised style of digital media content.

As technology and connectivity continue to evolve, it is likely that mobile multimedia will ultimately gain ground. But as it stands, media companies may have to focus more on innovation in content delivery and user interface design, while pushing for more affordable and equitable data policies.

This scenario serves as a wake-up call for tech firms, who may need to refocus their efforts on addressing the mobile multimedia adoption issues. Rather than simply increasing the technological capability of devices and networks, a holistic approach that fosters a comprehensive mobile multimedia experience is necessary to pave the way to the future.

Wales received an uplifting piece of news ahead of their forthcoming international engagements as their star player, Williams, returned to full fitness, promising to bolster the squad's performance.

Williams, who has been on the sidelines due to an injury, has now fully recovered and is expected to take part in the upcoming fixtures. His return could not have been timed better, as the coaching staff were looking for ways to bolster their lineup following a series of mediocre performances.

"Welcoming Williams back to full fitness is a game-changer for us. He brings so much energy, experience, and authority to our squad. His successful recovery from injury could not have come at a better time," shared the team's manager, clearly expressing his relief at having the star player back.

The 29-year-old has been a key aspect of Wales' success over the past few seasons, attracting plaudits for his robust performances on the pitch. His absence was keenly felt in their recent outings, with the side noticeably struggling to retain its earlier prowess.

However, now with Williams' return to full fitness, there are hopes that the team can once again consolidate its playing style that has been central to its past victories.

Coaches, teammates, and fans alike are excited about Williams return. Analysts believe that his presence will not only boost the performance of the team but also motivate other players who look up to him as a role model.

"Having Williams back on the field will not only improve our gameplay but also our morale. There's a certain confidence that comes with knowing that he's part of our lineup," one of his teammates expressed.

Williams' return is expected to be a major boost for Wales. Former US President George Bush has announced a fresh approach intended to tackle the increasing deficit that continues to burden the US economy. The strategy includes measures aimed at bringing budgetary discipline while stimulating economic growth. These statements were made during his recent speech at the economic summit in New York, providing insights into the course of action the Bush administration is set to take.

Bush's statements have come at a crucial time as the US is grappling with a rising deficit. According to the Congressional Budget Office (CBO), the federal budget deficit is projected to hit a record $3 trillion in the fiscal year of 2020, which is more than triple of that in 2019 and the highest as a percentage of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) since World War II.

President Bush addressed this issue stating, "The rising fiscal deficit is something our administration takes very seriously. It is paramount that we bring forward a set of tough, strategic, and concrete steps that can guide us towards an efficient and effective solution."

Proposed measures include a combination of spending cuts and tax reforms. They aim to fundamentally transform entitlement programs such as Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid that have been the key drivers of the long-term debt. While fleshing out details, Bush emphasized the necessity to forge bipartisan support to ensure the strategy's successful execution.

"Addressing the deficit issue is not a matter of partisan politics, but a shared responsibility amongst all Americans," said Bush. "The journey to fiscal responsibility will be tough, but I am confident that we can navigate through these challenging times."

Moreover, Bush's tough strategy also involves tax reforms to stimulate economic growth. "We believe the engine of America's prosperity is a thriving private sector," he noted. He argued firmly for lowered business tax rates and simplifying the tax code to promote investment and innovation.

The announcement was met with mixed criticism and praise. While many conservatives lauded the president for taking a bold stance, liberals voiced their concerns about potential social inequality that these measures could create.

Although the details of this strategy are still under wraps, it's clear that President Bush is prepared to get 'tough' on this significant issue. It remains to be seen how these directives will influence the country's ever-vital question of economic recovery and sustainability in the times to come.

Tech giant Apple has initiated legal action to stem the flow of confidential company information, specifically relating to their new products. This move represents an intensified effort by the company to put an end to anticipatory press buzz that tends to surround their product line updates and launches.

According to reports, the Silicon Valley based company has taken legal proceedings against several individuals who've been allegedly leaking Apple's proprietary and confidential information. The identities of these individuals havent been disclosed, but they are assumed to be Apple employees or contractors who have signed nondisclosure agreements.

Apple's decision to pursue legal action demonstrates a significant shift in its handling of leaks. Previously, the company had been dealing with such matters internally. However, recent high-profile leaks of their products prior to launch have seemingly pushed the tech giant to take stronger action.

This change in strategy may be due in part to the nature and size of recent leaks. Prior to the formal announcement of the iPhone 12, for instance, several websites and online forums were awash with detailed information about the device, including its specification, design, and release date.

Apple's specific claims in these lawsuits are unclear at present, but it is expected they will assert infringement of trade secrets, confidentiality obligations and, potentially, express breaches of employment or contractor agreements.

An Apple spokesperson made a statement remarking, "Leaks harm our users and our business. They increase the chances of counterfeit products, lower the trust in our brand, and give competitors an unfair advantage." 

The spokesperson emphasised that Apple prides itself on making cool products that surprise and delight customers. These leaks, however, rob customers of the excitement of getting to know the new product at the time of the official announcement.

The company has previously dispatched letters to employees reminding them of the company's firm policy against leaks. These letters also highlighted that such transgressions not only lead to job termination but, as seen from recent events, could potentially lead to legal consequences.

The outcome of these legal proceedings is yet to be known. But if successful, it could set a precedent for other tech companies also struggling with leaks of proprietary information, leading to a more comprehensive crackdown on such activities in the technology world. 

There has been no public statement or comment on this matter from the accused yet, and the dates for the court proceedings are yet to be decided.

The Nasdaq Stock Exchange is reportedly planning to raise capital through the sale of $100m worth of shares, according to financial industry sources. This move comes as the US-based exchange seeks to fund strategic initiatives and potential acquisitions. 

Whilst no comments have been made by official Nasdaq spokespeople, financial insiders have potentially linked these plans to the Exchange's need for extra capital following a series of international expansion moves and partnerships throughout the past year. 

Nasdaq has been making significant advancements into global markets, seeking to strengthen their position against key competitors such as the New York Stock Exchange. The proposed share sale could potentially provide the financial bandwidth to further enable this process.

However, some analysts have raised concerns of share dilution. This sale, they warn, could potentially devalue current stocks, potentially limiting the ability of current shareholders to achieve significant gains. Despite this potential drawback, other market experts have pointed to the strength of Nasdaq's balance sheet and continued growth, indicating that this could be a strategic move to take advantage of the current bull market.

Nasdaqs last share offering was in 2006, when it sought to purchase a large stake in the London Stock Exchange. While the bid was unsuccessful, the money raised allowed for substantial development and expansion within the firm.

The Exchange has not released any official timeline for this potential share sale; however, if plans proceed, it will likely come within the next several months.

This sales initiative would be subject to regulatory approval in the United States. Given Nasdaq's stature and economic importance, the sale would likely be heavily scrutinised by official regulators. 

Nasdaq, while being the second-largest exchange operator by market capitalisation in the world, complements its exchange operations with a strong technology segment that sells systems to other exchanges. This share sale might also be a move designed to raise capital for further investments in this area.

Investors, shareholders, and analysts around the global market will be keeping a close eye on further developments regarding this potential sale. We will continue to monitor this story and provide updates as more information becomes available.

Henman, who has won this event twice before in his illustrious career, will be making his second appearance at the tournament since 2003. Meanwhile, Saulnier, who is playing his third Nottingham Open, has had a solid start this season with his near-perfect service game, prompting many to predict a likely victory for him.

However, Henman is no stranger to challenging matches. In the previous rounds, he effortlessly defeated Jamie Delgado after overcoming a minor set-back in the second set. This reasserted his position as a serious contender in this years edition of the open.

Both Henman and Saulnier have a strong service game, thus fans can expect a fantastic showdown. Saulnier will most likely focus on his-strong first serve, whilst Henman will adapt to his beautiful mix of serve and volley, which has always been his strength.

Experts opine that Henman will have to be on top of his game to beat Saulniers. The key to winning this clash will be dominated by the player who manages to hold his service more often.

Reflecting on his upcoming match, Henman highlighted the importance of maintaining focus. He said, "I have to get my serve in order. It's the most critical aspect of my game. He's a tough opponent with a great serve. I look forward to the competitive match."

The Henman-Saulnier clash is scheduled to begin at 2 pm BST on Wednesday, promising high-octane tennis at its best. This match looks to be a titanic struggle between two great players. It's definitely not one to be missed by any tennis enthusiast.

Sherlock Holmes has always been a crowd favourite, but it was actor Jeremy Brett who gave the iconic detective the most memorable television moment of 2004.

Jeremy Bretts depiction of Sherlock Holmes is far from forgotten, as the British public voted his portrayal of the famous detective in the episode "The Adventure of the Crooked Man" as the top TV moment of 2004. This comes from a poll conducted by a leading UK television magazine, where Brett's display of uncanny deduction skills and intense charisma gave life to Conan Doyle's fiction like never before.

The moment from "The Adventure of the Crooked Man" that struck a chord with viewers involves Holmes revealing the mystery behind the murder of Colonel Barclay, which heeerily solves with the help of a pet mongoose. Brett's indelible performance shines with his unique blend of quirkiness and intensity, making it the unmatched choice of viewers as the top TV moment of the year. 

Brett's Holmes beat a slew of popular moments from other TV hits, like the gripping climax of political thriller "State of Play" and the tearjerking farewell of Rachel Green in the series finale of "Friends". 

Brett, who passed away in 1995, portrayed the Victorian-Era detective from 1984 to 1994, appearing in 41 episodes. The actors distinctive representation of the character gave a new depth and dimension to Holmes, making him more relatable and human. His versatile acting skills kept the audience hooked to the TV series, faithfully adapting Doyle's stories.

The result of this poll is a testament to Brett's timeless performance and The Granada series' enduring impression on the viewers. This TV moment symbolizes the perfect blending of a compelling script complemented by an equally exceptional performance.

Upon news of the poll result, David Burke, who played Dr Watson alongside Brett, said, "Jeremy would have been so pleased. He was very proud of the series, and he would have been deeply moved by the acknowledgment of the audience even all these years later."

This recognition serves as a tribute to Brett's compelling performance and the effortless embodiment of Sherlock Holmes, etching an indelible mark on TV history through the sheer brilliance of one unforgettable moment.

In an ambitious move to combat poverty, the Indian government has rolled out a comprehensive budget aimed at disrupting the persistent cycle of deprivation among its distressed citizens. The anti-poverty budget, set to address critical issues of income inequality across the country, symbolises a renewed focus towards Social-Security led growth.

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, in her annual budget speech in the parliament unveiled a raft of pro-poor policies that will pour billions of rupees into the rural economy, health sector, and other critical social services. Among the eye-catching measures being proposed are substantial hikes in spending on public health and education, significant boosting welfare payments, and increased financing to housing and urban development programs.

Boosting rural incomes is among the critical concerns addressed through this budget. Creating more employment opportunities in rural areas is seen as a strategic move to facilitate reverse migration of workers who moved to cities and suffered during the Covid-19 lockdown periods. The rural jobs program is set to receive more than $8 billion, a nearly fifty percent increase compared with the previous budget.

The budget also includes heavy investments in universal healthcare, setting aside nearly $30 billion for health-and-wellness centres across the nation by the end of the current financial year. This initiative places special emphasis on strengthening health care in rural areas where medical facilities remain largely inaccessible for most of the population.

Another crucial announcement is the expansion of the nation's affordable housing scheme, with an emphasis on urban areas where the housing crisis is more pronounced. The Finance Minister pledged to deliver affordable housing for all urban poor by 2022. 

Education, claiming a significant slice of the budget, plans to improve and expand access to quality education for underprivileged children across the country. The government has set aside an unprecedented sum to this sector, promising an innovative approach to ensure children in remote areas benefit from the digital revolution.

Reaction to the budget has been mixed. While many praise the bold step towards poverty alleviation, critics argue about the risks of the budget deficit. However, the government stands firm on the priorities set forth in the budget, expressing confidence in long-term economic growth brought about by investment in human and social capital.

It is clear that the government has prioritised alleviating poverty and reducing inequality over short-term economic yardsticks with this budget. The measure will certainly go some way in helping stressed and disadvantaged segments of Indian society while reflecting India's commitment to achieving Sustainable Development Goals set by the United Nations.

The success of these measures, however, will critically depend on how effectively they are implemented and the resilience of the Indian

Former world number one, Justine Henin-Hardenne, is set to make a highly anticipated return to professional tennis at the Sydney International tournament. The Belgian star had been side-lined due to a viral infection that affected her performance and physical health.

Henin-Hardenne, who has won seven Grand Slam titles, was forced to withdraw midway into the 2006 season after being diagnosed with the energy-sapping virus, known as cytomegalovirus. Her return to professional tennis is seen as an occasion of celebration and a testament to her resilience, both attributes for which she is widely admired.

When asked about her comeback, Henin-Hardenne said she had worked hard to improve her physical health and is excited about the opportunity to hone her performance in Sydney before the first Grand Slam of the year, the Australian Open.

Her fans across the globe are eagerly anticipating her return, and are hopeful that she will once again be able to compete at the pinnacle of the women's game. Henin-Hardennes return to Sydney will indeed be a remarkable event marking the spirited comeback of one of tenniss most formidable stars. Regardless of the outcome, her journey of resilience serves as a profound lesson to many aspiring athletes worldwide.

Renowned computer engineer and designer, Jerry Manock, acknowledged as the creator of Apple's initial Macintosh computer, has passed away. He was instrumental in shaping the future of personal computing with his revolutionary contributions.

Mr. Manock, who was 82, had been a key figure in the technological landscape, helping to orchestrate the design of the first Apple Macintosh computer, which was released in 1984. The Macintosh was the first mass-market personal computer to feature a graphical user interface and a mouse, elements now familiar to every computer user.

Born in Wilmington, Delaware in 1939, Manock graduated from the University of Vermont with a mechanical engineering degree. He later earned a Masters degree in Product Design at Stanford University. He was recruited by Steve Jobs in 1979 to develop an external case for Apple II, where he worked as an industrial designer and Mechanical Engineering Manager.

Manock is often admired for encapsulating Steve Jobs' vision of a 'computer for the rest of us'. His extraordinary design of the Macintosh was streamlined, approachable, and distinct, separating it from other machines available in the market during the era. It set the stage for Apple's enduring commitment to marry technology with aesthetics.

Besides his work with Apple, Manock also co-founded the design consultancy firm, Manock Comprehensive Design, involved in many major projects concerning computer and industrial design. After leaving Apple in 1984, he resumed as a lecturer at the University of Vermont in the Department of Mechanical Engineering until his retirement in 2010.

"Jerry Manock significantly influenced the shape of personal computing. His vision and design principles gave life to technologies that have transformed human interaction with machines. His legacy lives on in the homes, offices and schools where Apple products are used," said technology analyst, Michael Gartenberg.

Jerry was not only incredibly talented but was a humble and gracious colleague. He will be greatly missed, said Susan Kare, another of Apple's early pioneers.

Manock's death comes as a significant loss to the technology world. His work continues to inspire modern Apple design teams, and his many contributions to the industry are a testament to his lasting legacy. His innovative design and dedication to simplicity and functionality transformed the field of personal computing, enabling tech giants like Apple to redefine user experience and influence the way we interact with technology today.

Sprinter, Jemma Holmes, has been hit by a devastating hamstring injury, a setback that could potentially disrupt her preparations for the forthcoming World Athletics Championships. 

Holmes, who holds the current national record in the 100m and 200m respectively, sustained the injury during a training session in Birmingham and is now waiting to ascertain the extent of the injury.

While she was pushing her limits during a routine sprint training, an abrupt pain in her right hamstring led her to halt. The 26-year-old was promptly treated on the spot and sent for further medical evaluation. The event undoubtedly cast a cloud over what had been a highly promising build-up to the championships.

The world silver medalist's coach, James Johnson, expressed his concerns during a press conference. "We are hopeful that it's not too severe but at this point we need to wait for the medical assessment," he said. "Losing Jemma would undoubtedly be a blow to the team, but we have a strong contingent ready to step up."

This injury comes at a time where Holmes was in peak form, having recently posted personal bests in the Diamond League. She also won gold at the European Championships last year, strengthening her reputation as one of the world's leading sprinters.

The British Athletics is yet to release a formal statement regarding Holmes' condition, but an announcement is expected shortly. 

Holmes has expressed her disappointment about the injury yet she remains hopeful about a quick recovery. In a post on her social media account, she wrote, "These challenges are part of the game, they test us, make us stronger. Im going to do everything in my power to get back on the track soon. Thank you all for your messages of support".

Meanwhile, the World Championships, which are due to start in less than a month, are still scheduled to go ahead as planned. However, the potential absence of Holmes could seriously dent Britain's chances of securing a medal in the short sprints.

Whether Jemma Holmes will run at the World Athletics Championships will likely come down to the results of the medical assessment, her rate of recovery, and the risk presented to further injury upon participation.

For the first time in the history of competitive e-sports, a global tour featuring the world's elite video gamers will launch later this year. The tour will showcase the top players and teams across different games at events staged in some of the planet's most iconic venues.

Riding the wave of recent successes in the e-sports industry, which saw surge in popularity during the pandemic, this world tour aims to make video gaming 'a spectator sport.' Whether you are a fan or a player, this initiative will truly put e-sports on the global map.

The tournament series will host iconic games, such as League of Legends, Fortnite, Call of Duty, Dota 2, and CS:GO, featuring top rankings players going head to head in these popular video game titles.

This initiative involves collaboration with major game publishers, developers, and local e-sports organizations around the globe to ensure a top-tier experience for the fans and gamers alike.

The tour will commence in Los Angeles, then move to Berlin, Seoul, Tokyo, Sydney, and finish in London. In every city, fans will get an opportunity to watch their favorite players and teams in action and to experience the thrilling atmosphere of high-level e-sports competitions.

"The aim is not just to give the best players a platform to showcase their skills, but also to turn these events into a celebration of video gaming culture," said the event's spokesperson, adding that there would be gaming expos, meet-and-greet sessions with top players, merchandise stalls, and much more.

The tour announcement has created a significant buzz in the gaming community. Top players are excited about the opportunity to compete in a global platform, expressing hopes that the tour could contribute massively to the growth and recognition of e-sports worldwide.

As e-sports continue to grow in popularity, with millions of fans tuning in to watch tournaments online, this world tour could solidify video gaming's place as a mainstream form of entertainment. 

The global touring circuit is set to make e-sports history, bringing competitive gaming to new audiences and giving fans the chance to experience the action like never before. With video gaming now a billion-dollar industry, it is a field that's only going to keep growing, and the upcoming world tour seems to be marking the start of a thrilling new chapter.

It's interesting to take a step back and reflect on how much the world has evolved over the past five years. I've scrolled through social media, news articles, and personal memoirs to compile a noteworthy list of changes we've experienced.

First off, let's start with technology. Five years ago, virtual voice assistants like Alexa and Google Home were still very much in their infancy. Now, they've become such an integral part of our lives, helping us with everything from managing schedules to controlling our home's lighting. Drones, virtual reality, and electric cars weren't as ubiquitous as they are today either. Tech giants have truly redefined our lives in the last five years.

In the world of social media, the popularity of platforms has seen a shift. While Facebook and Twitter remain popular, Instagram, and the newbie, TikTok, have taken the social media world by storm. They've shifted the paradigm of how content is created and shared, paving the way for new influencers and trends.

Global politics has also gone through major changes. New leaders have emerged and policies have shifted, sparking global debates and redefining political alliances. The geopolitical landscape of 2016 looks unrecognizable now.

Regarding our environment, there has been a substantial surge in awareness about climate change and the importance of sustainable living. More people are transitioning towards plant-based diets and eco-friendly products which was not that prevalent half a decade ago.

Lastly, a mention of the last five years would be incomplete without acknowledging the unprecedented pandemic. Covid-19 has revolutionized all facets of life, from work to education to social interactions, bringing about the birth of a "new normal".

All these changes are a testament to the fact that the only constant in life is in fact - change. It would be fascinating to imagine what the next five years will bring!

I appreciate this platform as a place where people can come and vent, share experiences, learn, and ultimately be part of a collective. Today, I want to talk about a frustration that I am guessing many of you can relate to, one that really tests my patience, namely: the silent treatment.

How is it that in the 21st century, where we have tools and platforms for communication so advanced and diverse, some people still resort to giving the silent treatment instead of sharing or discussing their feelings and thoughts? When faced with such behaviour, I find it truly flabbergasting. The silent treatment often escalates miscommunications, assumptions, and wrong-doings because no one is stepping forward to clear the air or explain their side.

What's worse is that this "weapon" is exercised not only in interpersonal relationships but also in professional settings. You've made a mistake, instead of communicating and rectifying the issue, your superior or coworker suddenly starts treating you like you're invisible. The key to resolving any issue lies in conversation, not avoidance.

I conclude this post by urging everyone who reads it to communicate instead of closing off. Silence may be golden, but not when it sows the seed of misunderstandings and conflicts. 

Remember, a problem talked about is a problem half-solved. Please share your thoughts on this.

However, recently I have been feeling a strong calling to reconnect with this part of my ancestry. I have been considering learning more in-depth about the Romani culture, its language, history, folklore, and partaking in its traditions and practices. I believe that honoring and keeping alive my ancestral culture is an excellent way of preserving it for future generations. Moreover, I feel it's a deep standard of respect for my ancestors who could not openly express their culture due to societal repression & prejudices.

Despite my personal feelings, some of my friends have expressed their concerns and reservations about this. They argue that focusing on a culture like this is considered cherry picking or even a form of cultural appropriation, as I did not grow up within the Romani community.

Several days ago, I found my ants dead in their terrarium. I had been passionate about creating the perfect habitat for them and was devastated. I don't understand what went wrong and desperately need help figuring it out.

Here's a bit about how I've been caring for them:

I kept them in an enclosed ant terrarium, ensuring they had sufficient space to move around. I maintained a consistent temperature of around 75-80 degrees Fahrenheit and kept the enclosure in an area where it received moderate indirect sunlight.

As for their diet, I provided them with an array of sweet food, protein, and water. For instance, I occasionally gave them small pieces of fruits, honeydew, and mealworms. I tried to maintain a balanced diet for them and ensured that their food was fresh. Additionally, I provided water through a test tube setup to prevent excessive moisture.

I know ants require some downtime during the winter months, but I didn't hibernate them since the species (Lasius niger) I was keeping does not need hibernation when kept indoors. 

Despite these efforts, they died. I'm really upset and at a loss for what might have happened. Have I missed something critical in maintaining the ants' housing or diet? What else should I be monitoring or adjusting to ensure their health and well-being? 

If there are any common newbie mistakes that might be causing this, please let me know. Also, any recommended resources or advice for first-time ant-keepers would be highly appreciated. 

I want to try again and give ants the care they deserve. I eagerly await your advice.

Thank you in advance.

So, just like many of you, I've found myself down many rabbit holes, investigating AoT and its sudden end. The abrupt tone shift, the character inconsistencies, the loose ends, it just didn't feel like AoT. It frustrated me, as I believed so deeply in Isayamas storytelling and character development.

I began looking back into past interviews and panels to see if Isayama ever mentioned anything about how he planned on ending Attack on Titan.

And surprisingly, there were numerous instances where Isayama's comments did not line up with the end we were presented with.

The most significant being his infamous 2013 interview in which he stated that he had planned a 'traumatic' ending similar to Stephen King's 'Mist.' Another instance was in the August 2020 Bessatsu Shonen Magazine interview where he stated that the current finale we got was the result of him wanting to reject the idea of a "tragic hero" ending. Not to mention, he had already planned out AoT's ending by 2018. However, the narrative shift hinting towards AoTs final ending happened only in 2019, way after 2018.

All this and much more make it very evident that the ending we got isn't what Isayama had originally thought of. The Isayama we know is a master of handling narratives with multiple layers of complexity, and to just leave us with such a simplified version, it just does not add up. 

This is not to say that we should disregard the current ending or launch campaigns demanding a "better" ending. No, not at all. Isayama has given us the right to perceive the story with our own interpretation. 

Looking at all this, it simply comforts me to know that Attack on Titan, the story I had invested in, was meant to end differently. It provides closure to my frustration and helps me reconcile with the final chapters.

Regardless of our varied opinions, I think one thing that unites us all is the profound love and respect we have for Isayama and his creation. So here's hoping for more clarity and resolution in the future! Lets continue supporting and appreciating AoT in all its glory.

Let's be thankful for the journey that Attack on Titan has taken us, and let's see what the future holds. Trust in the process, trust in Isayama.

I don't really know where to start, but things feel really heavy right now in my heart, and I just thought I'd share a bit about it here. Maybe someone out there can resonate, advise or provide some much needed solace.

I have always been introverted and found it hard to make meaningful connections with people. Since my childhood, the process of making and retaining friends has been quite arduous for me. Given my shy, introverted persona, I was basically always the odd one out in any social group. But amidst all this, there was one person who stood by me.

She was more than just a friend to me, someone who truly seemed to understand me. A person who saw the reticent boy behind the introverted facade, someone who despite my countless flaws and eccentricities, loved me for who I really was. She was my constant, my guiding star, the one who made everything around me feel less intimidating.

Recently, however, I've noticed a shift in her behaviour. She barely texts me, our conversations have become sparse and uninteresting. The spark that used to light up our discussions, the comfort we found in our shared solitude has seemingly vanished into thin air.

I tried talking to her about it, and she confirmed my fears. She told me that she just doesn't feel the same way anymore, that she was no longer able to value our relationship as she used to. I can't really explain how devastated that made me feel.

My one person, the only person who made me feel seen and cared for, doesn't seem to care for me anymore. I feel untethered and lost all over again. 

Dealing with this loss feels overwhelming, and I can't help but feel like I've somehow brought this upon myself. I could really use some advice on how to handle this situation. I apologise if this post isn't very coherent, my thoughts are rather scattered at the moment. I just couldn't think of anywhere else to unload these feelings.

Overthinking about what to say in conversation is a common experience shared by many. It's usually spurred by anxiety or fear of being judged by others and can often lead to missed social opportunities or feelings of regret. Here are a few strategies that may help you feel more at ease in social situations and improve the flow of your conversations.

1. **Practice Mindfulness:** Mindfulness involves focusing on the present moment and accepting it without any judgment. It can be a very effective way to manage overthinking. Next time you find yourself in a conversation, try to focus solely on the current dialogue, the topic discussed, and the person you are talking to at that moment.

2. **Prepare and Educate:** If you're nervous about a particular meeting or social gathering, prepare by brainstorming potential conversation topics. Keeping yourself informed about news, pop culture, or relevant topics can give you a fountain of topics to draw from.

3. **Allow Silence**: It is natural for conversations to have occasional pauses. Do not fear silence or feel the burden to always fill it. Sometimes, silence gives others the chance to process, think and contribute to the conversation.

4. **Listen Actively:** Conversations aren't just about speaking; listening is arguably even more important. Focus on what the other person is saying, ask relevant questions and show empathy. This can often lead the conversation naturally without you having to do too much of the talking.

5. **Be Authentic:** Remember to express your truth. People generally appreciate honesty and authenticity. You don't have to know everything or have a comment on every topic. It's okay to admit if you don't know much about a certain subject.

6. **Practice, Practice, Practice:** The more you expose yourself to social situations, the more comfortable you'll be when conversing. Start with small groups and work your way up. With time, this can significantly reduce your anxiety and allow you to feel more at ease. 

7. **Seek Professional Help:** If overthinking is causing significant distress, consider seeking help from a professional, such as a psychologist or a skilled therapist. They can provide you with more personalized strategies and tools to cope with these situations.

Reframing your attitude towards conversations and applying these techniques can alleviate the stress associated with social interactions. Remember, improvement takes time, patience, and practice, so don't be too hard on yourself when progress seems slow.
